New Records: Colombia extended their unbeaten run to 24 matches.
Colombia's ninth consecutive win maintained an impressive run of 19 victories and five draws since March 2022.
Key Match Events: Daniel Muñoz gave Colombia the lead in the 32nd minute.
Jefferson Lerma's glancing header evaded Paraguay goalkeeper Rodrigo Morínigo in the 42nd minute.
Julio Enciso netted the lone goal for Paraguay in the 69th minute.
The referee was advised to check the monitor by VAR and the decision was overruled for a potential penalty in the 84th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Colombia dominated the majority of the match.
Colombia's captain James Rodriguez said 'I'm very happy, it's important to start well today against a tough opponent like Paraguay.'
Post-Match Reflections: Colombia's captain James Rodriguez said 'We could have done better in the second half, but you correct things better when the team wins, it's much easier that way.'

Colombia winger Luis Díaz said 'Fortunately, we scored two goals that gave us a good lead to make it more difficult for them... We are calm. I have no doubt that we will have a very good tournament and we will continue like this.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at NRG Stadium in Houston, Texas, USA.
The game was broadcast on FS1.
Others: Both teams are set to return to the pitch on Friday, with Colombia facing Costa Rica in Glendale, Arizona, and Paraguay taking on Brazil in Las Vegas.
